definition: meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries

sentences.english: Strong thump massage function penetration muscle tissue, effectively relieve pain.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的捶击按摩功能渗透肌肉组织，有效地减轻酸痛。

sentences.english: But there are different kinds of muscle tissue.
sentences.chinese: 但是不同的肌肉组织是不一样的。

sentences.english: Answer: True. As you exercise, tiny tears form in your muscle tissue.
sentences.chinese: 当你运动时，细小的汗液在你的肌肉组织中形成。

sentences.english: You can use resistance tubing in your travel workout to build strength in nearly any muscle group.
sentences.chinese: 你能用它在你的旅行锻炼中锻炼任何的肌肉组织。

sentences.english: Buruli ulcer is a bacterial disease that eats away muscle tissue. People can become disabled.
sentences.chinese: 布鲁里溃疡是一种破坏人体肌肉组织的细菌性疾病。

sentences.english: Fat and muscle tissue are composed of two entirely different types of cells.
sentences.chinese: 脂肪和肌肉组织是由两种完全不同类型的细胞组成的。

sentences.english: This paper analyzes the feasibility of applying several smart materials to bionic fish muscle.
sentences.chinese: 分析了当前的智能材料用于仿鱼类肌肉组织的可行性。

sentences.english: TISSUE】The teacher showed pictures of muscle tissues and brain tissues.
sentences.chinese: 老师展示肌肉组织和脑部组织的结构图。

sentences.english: Moderate physical exercises promote the replacement of fatty tissue by muscle tissue.
sentences.chinese: 适量的运动能促进脂肪组织转化为肌肉组织。

sentences.english: What he is cutting through are subcutaneous fat and muscles.
sentences.chinese: 他现在在切离皮下脂肪和肌肉组织。

definition: articular capsule (of joint such as knee in anatomy)
fat (in the body, in a plant, or in food)
the body/organism (usually human)/(fig.) fabric (of society etc)/cohesive structure (of an entity)
